wikitext.*:
'''Wolvercote Cemetery''' is a municipal cemetery in north [[Oxford]]. It is the final resting place of [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]. He was buried with his wife, [[Edith Tolkien|Edith]]. [[John Tolkien| John Tolkien's]] grave is not far away from his parents' grave. [[Humphrey Carpenter]] is also buried in Wolvercote Cemetery.
[[File:Tolkiengrave.jpg|200px|right|thumb|The Grave of J.R.R and Edith Tolkien]]

== The Tolkiens' grave ==
Edith Tolkien died on [[29 November|28 November]], [[1971]], at the age of eighty-two, and Tolkien had the name ''Lúthien'' engraved on her stone.<ref>{{L|340}}</ref> On sundays after church he would visit her grave.<ref>{{B|VII}}</ref> When Tolkien died 21 months later of pneumonia on [[2 September]], [[1973]], at the age of 81, he was buried in the same grave, with ''Beren'' added to his name,<ref>{{B|VIII}}</ref> so that the engraving now reads:
:''Edith Mary Tolkien,'' ''Lúthien,'' ''1889 – 1971''
:''John Ronald Reuel Tolkien,'' ''Beren'' , ''1892 – 1973''
